column1: ^Working Class
@Riot
&Working class citizens started a riot to expose and punish bystanders, but sacrificed their time and money while doing so.*
The riot has lasted for 3 years now, and the government has forced participants to disband and go back to their normal lives.*
The riot has lasted for 6 years now, and the government has forced participants to disband and go back to their normal lives once again.*
Working class citizens ignored the government, and the riot has become a civil war.*
&Because of the riot started by the working class, a nuclear plant was forced to shut down.*
The working class's riot has strongly impacted your free riding activites.*
@Working Class Public transportation
&Instead of commute by cars, working class citizens decided to commute via public transportation.*
Old and management lacking public transportation system didn't grant you pleasant experiences.*
&With working class join the public tranportation group, people feel crowded in the vehicle, reduced their living quality.*
column3: Middle Class Public transportation%==%Working Class Public transportation

column1: With working class join the public tranportation group, people feel crowded in the vehicle, reduced their living quality.*
column3: Upper Class Public transportation%==%Working Class Public transportation

column1: @Working Class Local seasonal food
&Working class citizens make an effort to buy local and seasonal food; however, financial restrictions limit their choices.*
Eating only local and seasonal food for a while, you missed the taste of other variety of food choices.*
@Working Class Building
column3: Move to on-site renewable powered buildings

column1: &Working class citizens relocated to on-site renewable powered buildings; however, their commute to work was longer and living fees were higher.*
@Protest
&Working class citizens decided to protest for climate justice.*
&The working class increased your pressure to take action by protesting against you.*
The working class blamed you for environmental destruction and asked you to take immediate action in their protest against you.*
The working class exposed your excessive consumption of electricity, decreasing your brand image and impact.*
@Working Class Meat
&Working class citizens decided to eat less meat - though, vegetables are still expensive.*
It has been a long time of eating less meat, do you feel healthier?*
@Oneself
column3: Do nothing. You don't have enough power to make a change.

column1: &The working class fell into self-doubt.*
^Middle Class
@AC
&Middle class citizens began to reduce their AC usage.*
Middle class citizens experienced heat strokes due to hot summers and shortage of UC usage.*
As temperature raises worldwide, living quality without AC decreases further.*
@Middle Class Public transportation
&Instead of using cars, the middle class decided to commute via public transportation.*
&With middle class join the public tranportation group, people feel crowded in the vehicle, reduced their living quality.*

column1: @Middle Class Meat
&Middle class citizens decided to eat less meat - though, vegetables are still expensive.*
@Building
column3: Move to on-site renewable powered buildings

column1: &Middle class citizens relocated to on-site renewable powered buildings; however, their commute to work was longer and living fees were higher.*
After moving into new building, rent further squeezed living expanse.*
@Climate injustice
&Middle class citizens decided to address climate injustice, standing up for those impacted the most.*
&Because of middle class' protest, your reputation goes down a lot.*
Because of middle class' protest, people asking you to do somthing about climate injustice.*
@Middle Class Local seasonal food
&Middle class citizens make an effort to buy local and seasonal food; however, financial restrictions limit their choices.*
@Not enough power
column3: Do nothing. You don't have enough power to make a change.

column1: &The middle class gave up on trying to make a change.*
^Upper Class
@Fly
&Upper class citizens try to fly less, but their occupations and travel plans were impacted.*
Upper class continuting fly less, vacations and free time are shortened.*
@Divest
&Upper class citizens divested in non-environmentally friendly industries, but they lost potential money-making opportunities.*
&As upper class divesting, industries pay less wages to working class.*
As upper class divesting, industries pay less wages to middle class.*
As upper class divesting, industries that are been divested are bribing and forcing policy makers to make some change.*
@Electric Car
&Upper class citizens swapped their gas cars to electric ones; however, the process of mining lithium for these cars was harmful for the environment.*
&Upper class's demands for electric cars increase the demand of energy, on-site energy building become more valuable.*
Upper class's demands for electric cars increase the demand of energy, developing renewable energy become more valuable.*
Upper class's demands for electric cars increase the demand of energy, utility charge increases.*
Upper class's demands for electric cars increase the demand of energy, utility charge increases.*
@Upper Class Local seasonal food
&Upper class citizens made an effort to buy local and seasonal food, with the cost of needing to adapt their diet slightly.*
@Upper Class Public transportation
&Instead of using cars, upper class citizens decided to commute via public transportations.*
@others do it
column3: Push climate responsibility to others. They can take action first.

column1: &Upper class citizens put the responsibility to make a change on other people to avoid their own personal risks.*
@Advertise
column3: Advertise self for having green life

column1: &Upper class citizens were only superficially "green", and no one knew they were being ingenuine.*
&Having a role model from upper class influenced green education.*
^Company
@Change plastic package
column3: Switch plastic use to a more sustainable material

column1: &Companies replaced plastic packages to more eco-friendly ones. Will this expense be paid by the consumers or the companies themselves?*
@APSS
column3: Advance production scheduling system for optimal efficiency

column1: &Companies have started to develop a more efficient production scheduling system, costing money and time.*
Companies have finished the development of the system, increasing efficiency by a ton!*
The increase of efficiency slowed down because R&D reached a bottleneck.*
&Companies enhanced their production system, now they need less workers from working class.*
@Nuclear
&Companies decided to use nuclear power - fairly environmentally friendly and rich in energy but dangerous as well.*
&Developing renewable energy and nuclear energy, companies soon become rich in energy.*
@Renewable energy
&Companies changed their energy source to a renewable one; however, issues of generation and storage rose as a result.*
&Developing renewable energy and nuclear energy, companies soon become rich in energy.*
@Product lives
&Companies lengthened their product lives, but as demand went down, profit also went down.*
Having financial report that shows the decrease on profit, shareholders asking you to do something about it.*
@Reduce energy use
column3: Reduce factory and office energy use

column1: &Companies began to save energy in the workplace, but as a result, workers had to endure lower quality working conditions. *
&Companies tries to control energy use in work space, your comfort level during work is deducted.*
Companies tries to control energy use in work space, your comfort level during work is deducted.*
Workers are unhappy about companies' reduce of energy use in working space, they are asking for a more comfortable working experience.*
Workers supported your idea of not letting companies to reduce their working comforts.*
column3: Don't change a lot%==%Reduce energy use

column1: @Not enough benefit
column3: The costs outweigh the benefits. Prioritize profit rather than climate-related issues

column1: &Making profit was the core value of the companies, so climate-related issues were not a priority.*
^Policymaker
@Ban Ads
&A new policy banned non-environmentally friendly ads from public stations, those companies are very unhappy about this.*
&New policy banned companies' ads, Reduced your influence in market.*
Since companies used renewable energy, new policy only banned ads that are non-environmental friendly.*
New policy of ban ads didn't affect companies tho are using nuclear energy.*
@Control fossil fuel
&A new policy decreased fossil fuel energy consumption, but also increased costs of batteries for renewable energy storage.*
&Fossil fuel energy is been controled by new policy, which means working class needs pay more electricity fees.*
Fossil fuel energy is been controled by new policy, which means middle class needs pay more electricity fees.*
Fossil fuel energy is been controled by new policy, which means upper class needs pay more electricity fees.*
Fossil fuel energy is been controled by new policy, which means industry electricity fee raises in price.*
Fossil fuel energy is been controled by new policy, but companies didn't affected by that, because of their nuclear power.*
Fossil fuel energy is been controled by new policy, but companies didn't affected by that, because of their development in renewable energy.*
@Single-use plastic
column3: Decrease reliability of fossil fuels for energy production

column1: &A new policy tried to eliminate single-use plastics completely; however, costs of other packaging resources increased.*
&Policy of reducing single-use plastics Imperceptibly increase daily living expanse.*
Policy of reducing single-use plastics Imperceptibly increase daily living expanse.*
Policy of reducing single-use platstics asks companies to change their packages to more expansive materials.*
@Education
column3: Implement climate change education in the New York education system

column1: &A new policy pushed for environmental education in public schools - as a long term plan.*
@Reduce new road
&A new policy slowed down speed of constructing new roads and infrastructure, but also slowed down economic growth.*
&Because of reducing new road policy and your decision of flying less, upper class takes way more time on road.*
Because of reducing new road policy, intercity food transportation becomes harder. Fortunately, working class decided to eat more local foods.*

@Defend
column3: Don't combat climate change directly. Instead, focus on defence strategies to protect citizens.

column1: &There's not much policy-makers can do to combat climate change directly, so new policies focused on defence strategies from climate disasters.*
